Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2009 06:57PM Jane108 wrote: Don't be scared and try to think about living a long, happy life by getting all of this done.  I have Stage II A, had surgery in Jan., chemo started Mar. 10.  I had A/C 4 times and now Taxol for 12 weeks.  Next Wed. will be my last Taxol.  I get a 5-6 wk. break (and plan to go on vacation!) then I have radiation 5 days per wk. for 7 weeks.  After that I'll be placed on Tamoxifen for 5 years!!  My family keeps saying it is worth it although I thought about quitting many times.  Don't worry about nausea because before chemo, they give you many pre-meds and then you'll also take some at home.  Remember to keep up with lots of protein and fiber and drink lots and lots of water or any liquid.  Although I had many side effects, I got this far!  Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2009 07:02PM Jane108 wrote: I, too, had lots of "buzz brain" when I was on A/C.  My onco doc gave me a prescription for Lorazapam which is a mild tranquilizer.  Although I have never taken them before I got cancer, I don't know what I would have done without it.  I usually took it for several days after chemo and especially at night so I could sleep.  Mine was only .5 mg so it was a very small dose. Hope you can find something that will work for you.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2009 10:52AM Jane108 wrote: So sorry I haven't replied.  Don't know where you are on taxol but I did not get any side effects from it other than feeling tired on and off.  My step after that was radiation and tomorrow will be #35 out of 35, then onto Tamoxifen.  Let me know how your're doing.  Oh, during taxol, my hair started growing back but it's a slow, ongoing process.  Still very short.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 03:35PM Jane108 wrote: I hear you!  It's hard to make a decision.  I had chemo for stage II with lymph node invasion.  I had AC x 4 and Taxol x 12.  My doctor worked with me to see me through it.  When I told him I had neuropathy, he would stop the chemo for a week or two to give me a rest.  I also had an intestinal infection and again the chemo was stopped.  I continued until I received all 16 infusions.  I started my chemo in March 2009 and it ended in August 2009.  Then I had 36 rads and now I am on hormone therapy for 5 years.
Posts.Title: Stopping Chemo? Late Oncotype Score Dilemma DebRox Rennasus

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 03:39PM Jane108 wrote: I hear you!  It's hard to make a decision.  I had chemo for stage II with lymph node invasion.  I had AC x 4 and Taxol x 12.  My doctor worked with me to see me through it.  When I told him I had neuropathy, he would stop the chemo for a week or two to give me a rest.  I also had an intestinal infection and again the chemo was stopped.  I continued until I received all 16 infusions.  I started my chemo in March 2009 and it ended in August 2009.  Then I had 36 rads and now I am on hormone therapy for 5 years.  I believe it was all worth it because I gave myself the best possible chance.  I never even asked about an oncotype test....didn't want to be confused about my decision.  Today, I feel great.  I never walked before BC but now I walk at least 2 miles a day.  I also exercise with 5 lb. weights and eat healthy foods.  Chemo is not all that bad but you need to help yourself by keeping up your strength!  Hope you are able to make a decision you can be happy with!  I sure did!
Posts.Title: Stopping Chemo? Late Oncotype Score Dilemma DebRox Rennasus
